section.p: NOTE: Before attaching a volume, create a least one VM instance within Helion OpenStack. Without an instance, there will be no target to attach the volume to.

ol.li: In the Horizon Dashboard Volumes page, select the volume QNAP, and then choose Manage Attachments from the dropdown menu.
Choose the desired instance, then click Attach Volume.
The Volumes page should now show that the QNAP volume is attached to the instance.
From the menu, select Compute â†’ Instances. Select the desired instance and confirm that the Overview tab reports that the QNAP volume is attached.
Select the Console tab and log in to your instance.

Verify that the instance operating system recognizes the new volume with the following command:sudo fdisk -l
The following screenshot demonstrates sample output from the preceeding fdisk command. Your output may differ, depending on existing volumes and the size of the newly created volume.
